text: Frédéric Macler (26 May 1869 – 12 July 1938) was a French linguist, orientalist and translator. ==Biography== A native of Mandeure, Macler learned Armenian, Assyrian, and Hebrew from Auguste Carrière. In 1911, he succeeded Antoine Meillet, as he took a chair in Armenian at the Institut national des langues et civilisations orientales, which he held until 1937. In 1919, he co- founded the Society for Armenian Studies. In 1920, he founded the Revue des Études Arméniennes, which he directed until 1933, with Antoine Meillet. ==References== Category:1869 births Category:1938 deaths Category:People from Doubs Category:French linguists Category:French translators
